intro: Pterophylla marquesana var. marquesana, commonly known as the Marquesan starling plant, is a rare flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Pacific. It is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers that are typically pale yellow to white in color. The plant belongs to the family Malvaceae and is known for its unique leaf morphology, which features palmate lobes. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in coastal forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
